revised_title: Honeybee Social Behavior and Colony Organization
tldr: This article discusses the social behavior and organization of honeybee colonies, focusing on the factors that attract individual bees to join clusters and the role of the queen in maintaining colony cohesion. The study found that scattered worker bees are attracted to clusters by a combination of scent, vibration, temperature, and sight. Queens play a crucial role in keeping worker bees together, serving as a powerful attraction. The attraction to these stimuli is likely an important adaptation for social life.
